visit.detail: Table \`public.visit\` has a row level security policy \`visit_select_same_casino\` that re-evaluates current_setting() or auth.<function>() for each row. multiplePolicyIssues.name: multiple_permissive_policies
multiplePolicyIssues.title: Multiple Permissive Policies
multiplePolicyIssues.description: Detects if multiple permissive row level security policies are present on a table for the same \`role\` and \`action\` (e.g. insert). Multiple permissive policies are suboptimal for performance as each policy must be executed for every relevant query.
multiplePolicyIssues.detail: Table \`public.casino_settings\` has multiple permissive policies for role \`anon\` for action \`SELECT\`. Policies include \`{casino_settings_read,casino_settings_write}\`

multiplePolicyIssues.name: multiple_permissive_policies

recommendations: Fix auth function calls by wrapping them in subqueries: auth.uid()  (select auth.uid())
Test all policy changes in staging before production deployment
Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE to measure performance improvements
Consider batching policy updates to minimize downtime
